titleInfo.title: Proposed Great Smoky Mountains National Park, North Carolina-Tennessee (1926)

mods.abstract: This 1926 topographical map shows the proposed area for the formation of the Great Smoky Mountains National Park superimposed on an early United States Geological Survey (USGS) map of Blount, Sevier and part of Cocke counties in Tennessee and Haywood and Swain counties in western North Carolina. Roads, streams, mountain balds, coves, contour lines, and some pre-park communities are shown in great detail.

Along with convincing timber companies to sell many square miles of timbered tracts, the Park Commission had to negotiate (or force) the purchase of thousands of small farms and move people off their land. The commission also had to deal with state legislatures, finally completing most land purchases by 1932. The national park officially opened in 1934, with President Franklin D. Roosevelt presiding over the opening ceremony.

subject.topic: Great Smoky Mountains National Park (N.C. and Tenn.)--Maps
